verses.verse: Then <S%H347>Job<s%> <S%H6030>answered<s%> and <S%H559>said<s%>,
Of a <S%H551>truth<s%> I <S%H3045>know<s%> that it is <S%H582>so<s%>: But how can man be <S%H6663>just<s%> with <S%H410>God<s%>?
If he <S%H2654>be<s%> pleased to <S%H7378>contend<s%> with <S%H6030>him<s%>, He cannot answer him <S%H259>one<s%> of a <S%H505>thousand<s%>.
He is <S%H2450>wise<s%> in <S%H3824>heart<s%>, and <S%H533>mighty<s%> in <S%H3581>strength<s%>: Who hath <S%H7185>hardened<s%> himself against <S%H7999>him<s%>, and prospered? --
Him that <S%H6275>removeth<s%> the <S%H2022>mountains<s%>, and they <S%H3045>know<s%> it <S%H2015>not<s%>, When he overturneth them in his <S%H639>anger<s%>;
That <S%H7264>shaketh<s%> the <S%H776>earth<s%> out of its <S%H4725>place<s%>, And the <S%H5982>pillars<s%> thereof <S%H6426>tremble<s%>;
That <S%H559>commandeth<s%> the <S%H2775>sun<s%>, and it <S%H2224>riseth<s%> <S%H2856>not<s%>, And sealeth up the <S%H3556>stars<s%>;
That alone stretcheth <S%H5186>out<s%> the <S%H8064>heavens<s%>, And <S%H1869>treadeth<s%> upon the <S%H1116>waves<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea<s%>;
That <S%H6213>maketh<s%> the <S%H5906>Bear<s%>, <S%H3685>Orion<s%>, and the <S%H3598>Pleiades<s%>, And the <S%H2315>chambers<s%> of the <S%H8486>south<s%>;
That <S%H6213>doeth<s%> great <S%H1419>things<s%> <S%H369>past<s%> finding <S%H2714>out<s%>, <S%H6381>Yea<s%>, marvellous things without <S%H4557>number<s%>.
Lo <S%H5674><s%>, he goeth by <S%H7200>me<s%>, and I see him <S%H2498>not<s%>: He passeth on <S%H995>also<s%>, but I perceive him not.
Behold <S%H2862><s%>, he seizeth the <S%H7725>prey<s%>, who can hinder <S%H559>him<s%>? Who will say unto <S%H6213>him<s%>, What doest thou?
God <S%H433><s%> will not <S%H7725>withdraw<s%> his <S%H639>anger<s%>; The <S%H5826>helpers<s%> of <S%H7293>Rahab<s%> do stoop under <S%H7817>him<s%>.
How much less shall I <S%H6030>answer<s%> <S%H977>him<s%>, And choose out my words to reason with <S%H1697>him<s%>?
Whom <S%H6663><s%>, though I were righteous, yet would I not <S%H6030>answer<s%>; I would make <S%H2603>supplication<s%> to my <S%H8199>judge<s%>.
If I had <S%H7121>called<s%>, and he had <S%H6030>answered<s%> <S%H539>me<s%>, Yet would I not believe that he <S%H238>hearkened<s%> unto my <S%H6963>voice<s%>.
For he <S%H7779>breaketh<s%> me with a <S%H8183>tempest<s%>, And <S%H7235>multiplieth<s%> my <S%H6482>wounds<s%> without <S%H2600>cause<s%>.
He will not <S%H5414>suffer<s%> me to <S%H7725>take<s%> my <S%H7307>breath<s%>, But <S%H7646>filleth<s%> me with <S%H4472>bitterness<s%>.
If we speak of <S%H3581>strength<s%>, <S%H533>lo<s%>, he is mighty! And if of <S%H4941>justice<s%>, <S%H3259>Who<s%>, saith he, will summon me?
Though I be <S%H6663>righteous<s%>, mine own <S%H6310>mouth<s%> shall <S%H7561>condemn<s%> <S%H8535>me<s%>: Though I be perfect, it shall prove me <S%H6140>perverse<s%>.
I am <S%H8535>perfect<s%>; I <S%H3045>regard<s%> not <S%H5315>myself<s%>; I <S%H3988>despise<s%> my <S%H5315>life<s%>.
It is all <S%H259>one<s%>; therefore I <S%H559>say<s%>, He <S%H3615>destroyeth<s%> the <S%H8535>perfect<s%> and the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>.
If the <S%H7752>scourge<s%> <S%H4191>slay<s%> <S%H6597>suddenly<s%>, He will <S%H3932>mock<s%> at the <S%H4531>trial<s%> of the <S%H5355>innocent<s%>.

The <S%H776>earth<s%> is <S%H5414>given<s%> into the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>; He <S%H3680>covereth<s%> the <S%H6440>faces<s%> of the <S%H8199>judges<s%> <S%H645>thereof<s%>: If it be not he, who then is it?
Now my <S%H3117>days<s%> are <S%H7043>swifter<s%> than a <S%H7323>post<s%>: They flee <S%H1272>away<s%>, they <S%H7200>see<s%> no <S%H2896>good<s%>,
They are passed <S%H2498>away<s%> <S%H5973>as<s%> the <S%H16>swift<s%> <S%H591>ships<s%>; As the <S%H5404>eagle<s%> that <S%H2907>swoopeth<s%> on the <S%H400>prey<s%>.
If I <S%H559>say<s%>, I will <S%H7911>forget<s%> my <S%H7879>complaint<s%>, I will put <S%H5800>off<s%> my sad <S%H6440>countenance<s%>, and be of good <S%H1082>cheer<s%>;
I am <S%H3025>afraid<s%> of all my <S%H6094>sorrows<s%>, I <S%H3045>know<s%> that thou wilt not hold me <S%H5352>innocent<s%>.
I shall be <S%H7561>condemned<s%>; Why then do I <S%H3021>labor<s%> in <S%H1892>vain<s%>?
If I <S%H7364>wash<s%> myself <S%H7950>with<s%> snow <S%H4325>water<s%>, And make my <S%H3709>hands<s%> <S%H1252>never<s%> so <S%H2141>clean<s%>;
Yet <S%H227><s%> wilt thou <S%H2881>plunge<s%> me in the <S%H7845>ditch<s%>, And mine own <S%H8008>clothes<s%> shall abhor <S%H8581>me<s%>.
For he is not a <S%H376>man<s%>, as I <S%H6030>am<s%>, that I should answer <S%H935>him<s%>, That we should come <S%H3162>together<s%> in <S%H4941>judgment<s%>.
There <S%H3426>is<s%> no <S%H3198>umpire<s%> betwixt <S%H7896>us<s%>, That might lay his <S%H3027>hand<s%> upon us <S%H8147>both<s%>.
Let him <S%H5493>take<s%> his <S%H7626>rod<s%> <S%H5493>away<s%> from <S%H367>me<s%>, And let not his terror make me <S%H367>afraid<s%>:
Then would I <S%H1696>speak<s%>, and not fear <S%H3372>him<s%>; For I am not so in myself.
